daboross.gemagame.code

Class Collision

  • java.lang.Object
    • daboross.gemagame.code.Collision

  • public class Collision
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is all static functions that check collision.
    Author:
    daboross

    • Method Detail

      • isCollided

        public static boolean isCollided(double xPos1,
                 double yPos1,
                 double xPos2,
                 double yPos2,
                 double xLength1,
                 double yLength1,
                 double xLength2,
                 double yLength2)
        This function checks if 2 objects are collided, in any way overlapping
        Parameters:
        xPos1 - The x Position for the first object
        yPos1 - The y Position for the first object
        xPos2 - The x Position for the Second Object
        yPos2 - The y Position for the Second Object
        xLength1 - The x Length for the First Object
        yLength1 - The x Length for the First Object
        xLength2 - The x Length for the Second Object
        yLength2 - The x Length for the Second Object
        Returns:
        If the two objects are collided

      • isCollided1Above2

        public static boolean isCollided1Above2(double xPos1,
                        double yPos1,
                        double xPos2,
                        double yPos2,
                        double xLength1,
                        double yLength1,
                        double xLength2,
                        double yLength2)
        This function checks if 2 objects are collided with the first one above the second one
        Parameters:
        xPos1 - The x Position for the first object
        yPos1 - The y Position for the first object
        xPos2 - The x Position for the Second Object
        yPos2 - The y Position for the Second Object
        xLength1 - The x Length for the First Object
        yLength1 - The x Length for the First Object
        xLength2 - The x Length for the Second Object
        yLength2 - The x Length for the Second Object
        Returns:
        If the two objects are collided, first one above second one.

      • isCollided1LeftOf2

        public static boolean isCollided1LeftOf2(double xPos1,
                         double yPos1,
                         double xPos2,
                         double yPos2,
                         double xLength1,
                         double yLength1,
                         double xLength2,
                         double yLength2)
        tries to return true if object 1 is to the left of object 2, and is // collided with object 2. object one is defined by upper left point(xPos1,yPos1), and length(xLength1, yLength1) Object two is defined by upper left point(xPos2,yPos2), and length(xLength2, yLength2)
        Parameters:
        xPos1 - The x Position for the first object
        yPos1 - The y Position for the first object
        xPos2 - The x Position for the Second Object
        yPos2 - The y Position for the Second Object
        xLength1 - The x Length for the First Object
        yLength1 - The x Length for the First Object
        xLength2 - The x Length for the Second Object
        yLength2 - The x Length for the Second Object

      • isCollided1D

        public static boolean isCollided1D(double p1,
                   double length1,
                   double p2,
                   double length2)
        This function checks if two 1 dimensional objects are collided. If they are overlapping at all. This could be used to check if two objects were collided on only x or only y.
        Parameters:
        p1 - the position of the first object
        length1 - the length of the first object
        p2 - the position of the second object
        length2 - the length of the second object
        Returns:
        if the 2 objects are collided
